subhead: Israeli fighter jets struck nuclear and military sites across Iran on Friday. The offensive, code-named 'Rising Lion,' was deemed 'very successful' by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

War in Ukraine: Russia steps up its offensive in the Donetsk region
subhead: Seizing complete control of the region − nearly one-third of which remains under Ukrainian control − has been a primary goal for the Kremlin. The arrival of summer has made it easier for Russian forces to advance.

title: 'You've started a fire': TikTok execs fail to convince French lawmakers at hearing
subhead: On Thursday, several TikTok executives tried to reassure a parliamentary committee investigating the platform by outlining the measures implemented to protect minors.

title: Paris Games balloon returns to French capital, minus the Olympic name
subhead: The balloon has been installed in the Tuileries Garden. It will rise into the sky with its electric flame on June 21.

title: Two Jewish sisters' fight to honor the couple who hid them during the Holocaust
subhead: Arlette and Madeleine Testyler campaigned so that Jeanne and Jean Philippeau, who sheltered them during World War II, be recognized as Righteous Among the Nations. After some hesitation from the mayor, the town of Vendôme is organizing a ceremony on June 16 in which they will be honored by the Yad Vashem Institute.

Russian Wagner group fighters secretly detained and tortured civilians in Mali
subhead: Le Monde, Forbidden Stories and media partners investigated arbitrary arrests of Malians committed by Russian mercenaries. We reveal at least six bases where civilians were illegally detained and secretly tortured.
byline: By Thomas Eydoux and Benjamin Roger

title: French-Algerian woman given 48 hours to leave France in incomprehensible deportation order
subhead: A 58-year-old mother, who has been living in France since 1993 and holds dual nationality, was detained for an entire afternoon by border police at a Paris airport. She is contesting the order to leave French territory that was served to her.

title: The life and death of Julie, 21, swept up in the spiral of social media
subhead: Julie Pospieszny's tragic fate was that of a young woman of her generation, born into the age of social media and a victim of the violence it can unleash. Caught in the spiral of easy money and addicted to laughing gas, the influencer died in March. She was 21 years old.
